title: Why doesn't Sion get double stacking on howling abyss?

replies.body: We took a look at all the stacking champs on ARAM. Nasus was struggling, so he got some love. Sion by contrast already does quite well there, despite his stacking mechanic, so we didn't make any ARAM specific changes to him.

Nasus got double stacking on howling abyss because he isn't guaranteed to get minions on that map. Between enemy champions being able to poke him out of farm and allied champions also trying to get farm from the same minions he has, it's really hard to get stacks with Nasus.

Sion, on the other hand, isn't quite so reliant on stacks. His base kit has significantly more utility than Nasus' kit (multiple slows/knockups and an armor shred vs. a large slow and an armor shred), while his early game is also extremely powerful. Finally, Sion also gets stacks from kill or assist, which he gets a lot of on Howling Abyss (well, he at least gets a lot of the latter, not much of the former).

Veigar is a bit similar. He can farm stacks on hitting enemy champions or getting kills or assists, and since he's doing all three of those a lot he's still going to get tons of stacks.
His base kit is stronger in general compared to how much the other champions rely on their stacks. Same reason they don't do it for Veigar.

Because he gets a full stack off every assist, he can start {{item:3751}} and as long as he stays remotely close to the fights he actually gets stacks at an absurd rate. 

Not every stacking champ needs to be buffed for ARAM, look at {{champion:45}}.

{{champion:75}} is different because he not only has a useless early game (which is already a death sentence itself in ARAM), but has to somehow last hit from a single lane of minions, being shared by 4 other people, while constantly being poked by 5 other people, without being allowed to recall or teleport.

meaning he wont get any stacks anyway

lets be honest its a dumb buff because evryone will still be going ap
It's better than nothing.
It means that the two minion you do manage to snag gets you twice as much as before.

because sion is probably top 5 in melee champs for having on ARAM. his hide in bush AOE knockup, annoying passive in an enclosed space, and ult are all very strong on ARAM. and once you get warmogs he has insane sustain like garen/mundo all the other annoying super tanks late game on aram.

He genuinely doesn't need it, he's quite strong on that map, his drastically increased ability to effectively use his passive shores up any possible weaknesses he has, and he farms relatively easily for a melee on that map.
